results.title: Plastics into the future
results.creator_credit: Shane Mulcahy, Bruce Shearer and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Peter Couchman discusses with Bob Leschen of the Plastics Institute of Australia about the definition, application, types, manufacture and acceptance of plastics in everyday use.

results.title: Diabetes: not so sweet!
results.creator_credit: Gary Cuttris, Geoff Owen-Taylor and Australian Diabetes Foundation
results.brief_description: A comprehensive look at diabetes. In particular, a look at symptoms, causes, complications, care skills and diet. A number of specialists are interviewed regarding research. Various case studies are also shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gary Cuttris, Geoff Owen-Taylor and Australian Diabetes Foundation

results.title: The Kidney: the living machine
results.creator_credit: John Rodgers and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Peter Couchman discusses the function of the human kidney with Professor Graeme Campbell of the Melbourne Zoological Department. Discusses kidney malfunction and how this can be treated by dialysis together with footage of patients undergoing treatment at Prince Henry’s Hospital.

results.title: Transport in plants and animals: capture of nutrients in plants and animals
results.creator_credit: Shane Mulcahy, Glen Foster and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: 1. “Transport in plants and animals”. Explains how plants and animals transport their nutritional requirements internally. Similarities and differences between the transport methods are discussed. 2. “Capture of nutrients in plants and animals”. Every living organism needs a method of taking nutrients and of spelling waste products. This program examines which nutrients are esential to plants and animals and compares the system used to achieve this exchange of substances.

results.title: Skinsense
results.creator_credit: Peter Bence, Rob McCubbin and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: A general discussion on attaining and mantaining normal healthy skin. Includes haircare and shampoos, nailcare and general skincare, moisturisers, soaps, cosmetics and deodorants. The effects of sunshine on skin and protective behaviour are also covered.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Bence, Rob McCubbin and Victoria. Ministry of Education

results.title: Dinosaurs
results.creator_credit: Peter Bence, Steve Skok and Curriculum Branch, Ministry of Ed, Schools Div, Victoria
results.brief_description: Fossil records show that the dinosaurs were an enormously successful group containing many species. This program examines the reasons why they were so prolific and discusses some of the theories behind their disappearance.

results.title: Esty Deez
results.creator_credit: Tom McPartland, Sabina Wynn and New South Wales. Dept. of Health
results.brief_description: A frank look at the importance of using condoms to prevent sexually transmited diseases. Discusses the dangers of having multiple sexual partners and what should be done if an STD is contracted. Depicts the behaviour of adolescents together with contemporary language to ensure the attention of the intended audience. NB: TEACHER PREVIEW PRIOR TO CLASSROOM VIEWING IS RECOMMENDED.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom McPartland, Sabina Wynn and New South Wales. Dept. of Health

results.title: Sunrise sunset
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: This program shows some of the changes currently occurring in local industries, tracing the development of the robot industry and the implications this has had for production costs and changes in job direction. Particular emphasis is on the importance of research and development - ideas and innovations.

results.title: Integrated curriculum
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Chris O'Rourke, Lily Steiner and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Shows how an integrated curriculum can operate in classrooms with children ranging from preparatory to years five and six. It shows how different areas of the curriculum can be integrated to promote learning.

results.title: Preparing your child for school
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Glen Iver, Trevor Lunn and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: The start of a child’s schooling should set a positive tone for the rest of school life. This program looks at some common issues relevant to children about to start school and aims to put both the new pupil and the parent at ease.
